Description: Fires > 40 ha. Filtered to include fires from the preceding 30 years (i.e., 1980-2010? for comparison to the original model and 1990-2020 for the ring of fire projections)

Data set: MNRF road segments and Ontario road network
Description: Roads in both datasets that did not fully overlap were combined by removing roads from the Ontario road network that were within 100 m of a road in the MNRF data. Roads present in 2010 were approximated based on roads that had a year of construction in the MNRF data before 2010 or had no year of construction
Copyright: Contains information licensed under the Open Government Licence – Ontario.

Description: All railways were assumed to be have been present in 2010
Copyright: Contains information licensed under the Open Government Licence – Ontario.

Description: Utility lines present in 2010 were approximated by filtering the data by the ?business effective date?
Copyright: Contains information licensed under the Open Government Licence – Ontario.

Description: Landsat derived land cover data with 27 classes
Copyright: Contains information licensed under the Open Government Licence – Ontario.

Description: Operational cell claims data selected for the mining claim areas in the ring of fire by hand. For simplicity, only mining claims associated within the ring of fire (crescent) and associated large area to the south were used in modelling. Used to reflect anthropogenic disturbance in the Roads and Mines scenario

The proposed roads were derived from the operational cell claims and alienation data and converted to a line feature to calculate density. Proposed roads were combined with existing roads for the Roads Only scenario
Source data processed in QGIS to create proposed mine area
Source data processed in QGIS to create proposed roads
Used to clip data to Missisa range boundary?
